data.title: lucky find
data.text: Alway like pub food and had tried to go to Gennessee but the wait was almost 2 hours! found Scotland Yard pub, and, even though they were full, they found a way to seat us. We ordered burgers and fries... delicious! They are a bit understaffed, so the employees were working their tails off, but they were still great hosts! I recommend highly!

data.title: Awesome Bar, Food, and Halloween Decor
data.text: Bar tender was great in taking care of us (John)...made a great martini for my friend.   Nice selection of beer, couple local brews available.   Dragon sauce wings were superb...

data.title: Great Burgers
data.text: SYP would be easy to walk past, at first glance it looks like a typical neighborhood pub and not the kind that serves food- don't make that mistake, walk- in! This spot is a hidden gem anchoring an end of town that looks like it's trying to recover. Excellent, friendly service, a huge variety of taps and a pub menu I'd like to come back for more of. Burgers are large, fresh and can be basic or creative. They also had other bar sandwiches and apps and a few pub like entrees. Large, upscale crowd was forming for trivia night as we left. Highly recommended

data.title: Friendly staff
data.text: We dropped in here on a Monday afternoon for a drink. The staff was extremely friendly, the beer was good, wine selection was also decent. The atmosphere in general was a pub atmosphere. We will be back.

data.title: Great little pub
data.text:
We visited this place in the middle of a rush.  The staff were running off their feet to look after everyone.

The place is comfey, and the atmosphere is good.  The beer selection was a hood mix of standbys and craft brews.   The food selection was a good pub selection.  I always judge a place by their burgers...This burger was very yummy!  The fries were a cut above standard.  A later visit introduced me to the deep fried cheese.. Yummo!

Walking to this place from our hotel, the area seemed a bit dodgy, but the 8 of is were not bothered on the 5 minute walk.

data.title: Awesome pub
data.text:
This is my favorite bar in the downtown area.  The dragon sauce is the bomb!  Had it on my wings-they were the best.  The offer a dragon sauce blue cheese dip with them.
The service is good and it is a new favorite for me!

data.title: Authentic Food
data.text: Real English food! We had wood fired shepherds pie and fish & chips. My British husband truly enjoyed a taste of home. Brilliant!

data.title: Nice little place
data.text: A nice little place for drinks. Good live music on a Friday night. Good selection of draft beer and liquors.

data.title: New Years eve
data.text:
Was looking for a place to drink, dine and shoot pool before the fireworks which were canceled due to the terror threat.  Have driven by the place dozens of time but avoided the areas due to the troubles at the now closed nightclubs. 
What a nice place!  Great English pub feel and decor, very good comfort food. Service was excellent. Nice selection of local craft beers. We'll be back

data.title: What a great pub
data.text: We ate here several time before going to the theatre over the past few years but mist recently October 2015.  Great, attentive staff who care about your pleasant dining experience.  Everything we have tried we have liked.  If you stop in we highly recommend the chicken wings with their house sauce!

data.title: Loved this place!!
data.text:
I joined some friends for some drinks and dinner at this great pub.  We shared chicken wings to start - they were great.  -5 of us shared an order of 20 wings.  The wings were some of the best I have had.  Dipping sauce was great too- not blue cheese.  I had the Dragon's breath pizza-loved it!!!
This is a pretty popular place we called ahead and they held a table for us.  Went on a Friday.  We were going to a show at the Water Street and you can walk right from here.

data.title: Fun spot for drinks
data.text: Good British Pub vibe.  Decorated for Halloween at the time - rather graphic horror display.  Had the Shepards pie which was only OK.  Ingredients piled in a bowl and browned in the oven. Wait staff was attentive.

data.title: Great Atmosphere and food
data.text: Stopped in for lunch and had a great meal. It was hot and very tasty. Great place with a nice pub atmosphere. Definitely a place to stop in when in downtown Rochester. A+ service.

data.title: Dragon Sauce is good!
data.text: I enjoyed my visit to The Scotland Yard Pub.  The only thing that I found really annoying, is that they don't have a beer list...?  It was loud and very hard to hear all of the beers that were on tap from the bartender.  It would be much nicer if they had a beer list.  I honestly can't remember the last time I was in a good craft beer bar that didn't have a beer board or beer list.  Other than that, the beers were good and the selection was decent.  The Dragon Burger was amazingly good.  That Dragon Sauce is incredible.  I would imagine that anything they serve with Dragon Sauce is pretty darn good.  Service was very good, everyone was friendly and the bar is comfortable.  I will definitely return.

data.title: Good bar with pool table
data.text: Decent bar with good atmosphere. Went with the team and a good time was had by all. Pool table and darts along with a quiz while we were there. Proper pub!

data.title: Wonderful Place!
data.text: I had lunch (noontime meal) at the Scotland Yard Pub two times last week while in Rochester. I am so glad I found this place as I walked around town. I had the Fish and Chips for both meals and it was excellent. They served a cup of seasoned uncooked peas with the meal and I was surprised how good it was.  The atmosphere is traditional English pub, and the wait staff were friendly and attentive. The selection of beverages was also good, and I was free to try a drink of new things. I love the Scotch Ale!

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: Went with family for dinner here and tried a variety of items. Dragon wings, burgers, and pizza all were fantastic!  The burgers were juicy and full of flavor, the pizzas cooked to perfection, and the wings were plump and crispy. The house dragon sauce was all it was cracked up to be. We all agreed we would definitely get it again. The drink special was a blueberry vodka and lemonade mix and it went down way to easy. My only request of this place is to have a lager on tap next time. Nice selection of ales, but they need a lager. Oh, the waitress was great too!

data.title: If your in the city this is the place for great food and drinks
data.text: Wonderful pub with great food and drinks. Must try the burgers and pizza with the specialty sauce. Sooooo good. One of the juicest most flavorful burgers I've ever had. The drinks where just as good. Watched the woman's world cup during dinner. Not to crowded but had a constant stream of people coming in on a Tuesday night. We will be going back.

data.title: One of best burgers ever!
data.text: There are a lot of places with very good burgers but few rating and excellent score. I had the Dragon Bacon Blue burger and have to admit it tops my former fav burger at The Earl in East Atlanta. The dragon sauce is an original concoction here and is a sweet Asian/hot sauce blend- works perfectly with the blue cheese and beef juices. No other condiments needed on this burger - very drippy good! The toasted ciabatta bun holds it all together and whoever came up with that idea is a genius- I like soft buns but they just don't work on this type of burger. Fries also perfect to my taste- not too soft. Nice and attentive staff

data.title: Neat place!
data.text: We were there on a recent Friday night, never been there before. This is the type of place that if you can't have a good time it's your own fault. They had a band playing in the front, no cover charge! Everybody was friendly and accommodating. Draft beer selection was good, food was very good. The Dragon Wings are awesome!  This is a great place to have a couple drinks and a good time.
